contentrichtext.text: '''Trafalgar''' can refer to: ==Places== * [[Cape Trafalgar]] in south west Spain * [[Trafalgar Square]] in London, commemorating the British naval victory * [[Trafalgar, Indiana]], a town in the United States of America * [[Trafalgar Township]], a former municipality in Ontario, Canada * [[Trafalgar Moraine]], in Oakville, Ontario, Canada * [[Trafalgar, Nova Scotia]], Canada, a community within the Municipality of the District of St. Mary's, Guysborough County * [[Trafalgar, Victoria]], a town in Gippsland, Victoria, Australia * [[Trafalgar, Dominica]], a village and waterfall in the St. George province of the Commonwealth of Dominica, West Indies * [[Trafalgar, KwaZulu-Natal]], A town in South Africa ==Events== * [[Battle of Trafalgar]], fought near Cape Trafalgar * [[Trafalgar Campaign]], the events leading to the battle of Trafalgar * [[Trafalgar Day]], a commemoration of the battle of Trafalgar * [[Trafalgar 200]], bicentenary celebration of the battle of Trafalgar ==Vessels== * [[Trafalgar class submarine]]s of the Royal Navy * [[HMS Trafalgar]], any one of a number of British Navy ships ==Transportation== *''Trafalgar'' was one of the [[GWR 3031 Class]] locomotives that were built for and run on the Great Western Railway between 1891 and 1915; renamed Lambert in 1901. * [[Trafalgar Tours]], a travel company ==Music== * [[Trafalgar (album)|''Trafalgar'' (album)]], a 1971 album by the Bee Gees {{disambig}}
